# NSAccessibilitySlider

**Protocol**

A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a slider.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSAccessibilitySlider : NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
```

## Overview

Use this protocol when you want a user interface element to behave like a slider—a control that represents a continuous range of numerical values with a knob that represents the currently selected value—in the accessibility hierarchy.

You can further enhance the adopting element by implementing any of the information properties or action methods that the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol declares.



## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityLabel()**: Returns a short description of the slider.
- **accessibilityPerformDecrement()**: Decrements the slider’s value.
- **accessibilityPerformIncrement()**: Increments the slider’s value.
- **accessibilityValue()**: Returns the slider’s value.

## Value Controls

- **NSAccessibilityStepper**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a stepper.

## Inherits From

- NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
- NSObjectProtocol

## Conforming Types

- NSSlider
